content.title: Endograft Migration
content.definition: Movement of an aortic endograft more than 10mm caudally from its original position, which may lead to type I endoleak and loss of seal.

clinical_features.timing: May occur early or late post-EVAR
clinical_features.detection: Serial CT measurements from renal arteries

clinical_features.morphology: Conical neck, thrombus/calcium in landing zone

clinical_features.type_1a: Proximal type I endoleak most common consequence
clinical_features.rupture: Risk of aneurysm rupture if untreated

clinical_features.observation: If no endoleak and stable sac, may observe

clinical_features.prevention: Proper patient selection and device sizing

content.statement: Endograft Migration is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Complications that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Endograft Migration helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Endograft Migration include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Endograft Migration.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
